column4: Deere to lay off 600 employees at four factories
column5: Aug 15 Deere & Co  the world's largest maker of farm equipment  said it would indefinitely lay off 600 employees at four agricultural equipment factories.

column4: Maintenance to cut up to 9 pct of Enbridge's Mainline capacity
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Aug 15 Canada's largest pipeline company Enbridge Inc expects maintenance work over the next three months to cut throughput on the western leg of its crude export network by up to 9 percent  a company document seen by Reuters on Friday showed.

column4: FedEx indicted on new criminal charges in online pharmacy case
column5: SAN FRANCISCO FedEx Corp faces a new charge of conspiring to launder money in a U.S. criminal case over the company's drug deliveries for rogue online pharmacies despite warnings from law enforcement.

column4: UPDATE 1-FedEx indicted on new criminal charges in online pharmacy case
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 15 FedEx Corp faces a new charge of conspiring to launder money in a U.S. criminal case over the company's drug deliveries for rogue online pharmacies despite warnings from law enforcement.

column4: FedEx indicted on new criminal charges in online pharmacy case
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 15 FedEx Corp was indicted on Friday in a U.S. criminal case for conspiracy to launder money over deliveries for illegal online pharmacies  according to a court filing.

column4: Ford recalls 160 000 Focus  Escape models for wiring problem
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  is recalling nearly 160 000 Focus ST sedans and Escape crossovers from model years 2013-2014 to correct a wiring problem that could affect engine performance  the company said on Friday.

column4: Ford recalls 160 000 Focus  Escape models for wiring problem
column5: DETROIT  Aug 15 Ford Motor Co is recalling nearly 160 000 Focus ST sedans and Escape crossovers from model years 2013-2014 to correct a wiring problem that could affect engine performance  the company said on Friday.

column4: Brazil's MRV sees cancellations stabilizing at lower level
column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 15 Sales cancellations at Brazilian homebuilder MRV Engenharia e Participacoes SA  will likely fall back to the level seen in the first quarter and remain there through the end of the year  co-Chief Executive Officer Eduardo Fischer said on Friday.

column4: Brazil homebuilder MRV beats second-quarter earnings estimates
column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 14 Brazilian homebuilder MRV Engenharia e Participacoes SA beat profit expectations for the second quarter as demand for low-income housing remained robust while the negative impact from older  less profitable projects diminished.

column4: U.S. judge appoints lead counsel for GM ignition-switch cases
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 15 A U.S. judge has appointed two lawyers who led cases against Toyota Motor Corp and a plaintiffs' attorney from Texas to lead litigation against General Motors Co related to a faulty ignition switch that prompted the recall of millions of vehicles this year.

column4: GSK-linked investigators will not appeal China sentence: lawyer
column5: SHANGHAI British corporate investigator Peter Humphrey and his American wife Yu Yingzeng do not plan to appeal a Chinese court's decision to sentence them to prison  a lawyer told Reuters on Friday.

column4: GSK-linked investigators will not appeal China sentence-lawyer
column5: SHANGHAI  Aug 15 British corporate investigator Peter Humphrey and his American wife Yu Yingzeng do not plan to appeal a Chinese court's decision to sentence them to prison  a lawyer told Reuters on Friday.

column4: Exclusive: Burger chain Shake Shack preparing for an IPO - sources
column5: Shake Shack  the fast-food restaurant chain famous for its hamburgers and milkshakes  is preparing to go public  seeking to tap stock market demand for popular casual dining companies   according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: COLUMN-Tight spreads a potential trap for copper bears : Andy Home
column5: (The opinions expressed here are those of the author  a columnist for Reuters.)

column4: Top hedge funds flocked to Allergan amid bid backed by Ackman
column5: BOSTON Billionaire investor William Ackman  who often says he is flattered when others follow him into a stock he likes  was joined by several prominent hedge funds that made new bets on takeover target Allergan Inc  during the second quarter.

column4: IBM says sale of low-end server business gets regulator approval
column5: International Business Machines Corp IBM.N said on Friday that U.S. regulators had approved the $2.3 billion sale of its low-end server business to Lenovo Group Ltd 0992.HK  as the company continues its shift to more profitable software and services like cloud computing and data analytics.

column4: UPDATE 1-IBM says $2.3 bln server sale gets regulator approval
column5: Aug 15 International Business Machines Corp  said on Friday that U.S. regulators had approved the $2.3 billion sale of its low-end server business to Lenovo Group Ltd  as the company continues its shift to more profitable software and services like cloud computing and data analytics.

column4: James Hardie first quarter profit slides 80 percent  warns of slower U.S. recovery
column5: SYDNEY Australia's James Hardie Industries PLC    the world's biggest fiber cement products maker  said on Friday its first-quarter earnings tumbled and warned full-year profit will fall short of analyst expectations as the U.S. housing market recovers more slowly than it previously anticipated.

column4: UPDATE 1-James Hardie Q1 profit slides 80 pct  warns of slower US recovery
column5: * Company's FY 2015 outlook below analyst forecasts   (Adds profit detail  shares  housing market outlook)

column4: Australia's James Hardie shares slump  touch 4-month lows after profit drop
column5: SYDNEY  Aug 15 Shares in Australia's James Hardie dropped as much as 7.5 percent to touch four-month lows on Friday after posting an 80 percent fall in fiscal first quarter net profit and revised down its full-year earnings.

column4: Morgan Stanley must pay $4.5 million to Banamex: panel
column5: A unit of Morgan Stanley  must pay $4.5 million to Citigroup Inc's  Banamex unit which alleged the firm had allowed funds in a family's trust account to be used to repay third-party loans without its authorization  according to a ruling on Friday.

column4: California expands tax credit for stealth bomber to Northrop Grumman
column5: SACRAMENTO Calif. California on Friday offered tax incentives to an aerospace company seeking to build the next generation of stealth bombers  after controversy that the state had earlier offered the valuable tax breaks only to its main competitor.

column4: Fitch Publishes 'A-' Rating for ORIX; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) TOKYO/HONG KONG/SINGAPORE  August 15 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has published  Japan-based ORIX Corporation's (ORIX) Long-Term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) of  'A-'. The Rating Outlook is Stable. The agency has also published the company's  Short-Term IDR of 'F2'.     KEY RATING DRIVERS - IDRs ORIX's IDRs reflect its modest leverage  adequate liquidity position and track  record of having remained profitable over the past half century  the la

column4: SeaWorld to build bigger enclosures for killer whales in U.S.
column5: Theme park operator SeaWorld Entertainment Inc. said on Friday it would nearly double the size of its San Diego killer whale tank and expand similar enclosures in Florida and Texas amid criticism over its treatment of the animals.

column4: UPDATE 1-SeaWorld to build bigger enclosures for killer whales in U.S.
column5: ORLANDO  Fla.  Aug 15 Theme park operator SeaWorld Entertainment Inc. said on Friday it would nearly double the size of its San Diego killer whale tank and expand similar enclosures in Florida and Texas amid criticism over its treatment of the animals.

column4: SeaWorld to build bigger enclosures for killer whales
column5: Aug 15 Theme park operator SeaWorld Entertainment Inc said it would build bigger enclosures for its killer whales amid raging controversy over its killer whale shows.

column4: Nikkei steps back after 4-day winning streak; Sony jumps
column5: * Japan market should stay resilient on GPIF hopes - traders     * Sony up on report it plans to enter automotive image sensor market     * Nikkei up more than 3 pct for the week      By Ayai Tomisawa     TOKYO  Aug 15 Japanese stocks snapped a four-day winning streak on Friday morning  as investors took a breather ahead of the weekend though Sony Corp rose on a report that it will enter the automotive image sensor market.     The Nikkei dropped 0.2 percent to 15 289.76 in midmorning

column4: NASCAR tells drivers to stay in cars in wake of fatal crash
column5: NASCAR on Friday said it would forbid drivers from getting out of their cars during caution periods following an on-track fatality last weekend when three-time champion Tony Stewart struck another driver.

column4: U.S. supermarket chain Supervalu investigating potential data breach
column5: Supervalu Inc said it is investigating a potential data breach that could have affected some of its retail food stores  including some of its associated stand-alone liquor stores.

column4: U.S. judge appoints lead counsel for GM ignition-switch cases
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 15 A U.S. judge has appointed two lawyers who led cases against Toyota Motor Corp and a plaintiffs' attorney from Texas to lead litigation against General Motors Co related to a faulty ignition switch that prompted the recall of millions of vehicles this year.

column4: Tyson Foods looks for other pork export markets after China ban
column5: CHICAGO Tyson Foods Inc  plans to find other export markets for its pork products after a recent delivery to China triggered an export ban of half its U.S. hog slaughterhouses  the company told Reuters Friday.

column4: Tyson Foods looks for other pork export markets after China ban
column5: CHICAGO  Aug 15 Tyson Foods Inc plans to find other export markets for its pork products after a recent delivery to China triggered an export ban of half its U.S. hog slaughterhouses  the company told Reuters Friday.

column4: U.S. Bank hires adviser from JPMorgan Private Bank
column5: Wealth manager U.S. Bank  a unit of U.S. Bancorp  hired Timothy Langbein from JPMorgan Private Bank as a senior private banker for its private client reserve in New York.

column4: MOVES-U.S. Bank hires adviser from JPMorgan Private Bank
column5: Aug 15 Wealth manager U.S. Bank  a unit of U.S. Bancorp  hired Timothy Langbein from JPMorgan Private Bank as a senior private banker for its private client reserve in New York.

column4: Robust manufacturing output buoys U.S. economic outlook
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. manufacturing output rose broadly in July and automobile production recorded its largest increase in five years  boosting the economy at the start of the third quarter.
